title: Strategic Planning and Operations Analyst
job_description: DescriptionAmazon Web Services (AWS), a subsidiary of Amazon.com and a leader in cloud computing, is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Strategic Planning and Operations Analyst to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between business stakeholders and technical teams, including data engineers, analysts, and data scientists. The primary responsibility will be to communicate business requirements effectively to ensure data-driven solutions aligned with the organization's strategic objectives. The talented individual contributor will work closely with strategic planning leaders, analytics and finance teams on projects aimed to advance the prioritization of strategic priorities, prove the measured value of potential and current initiatives. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work at the intersection of business and technology, shaping data-driven solutions that drive organizational success.Key job responsibilitiesRequirement Gathering And Analysis Collaborate closely with business stakeholders, to understand and document their requirements, challenges, and desired outcomes.Conduct in-depth analysis of existing processes, systems, and data flows to identify areas for improvement and opportunities for optimization.Translate complex business requirements into technical specifications that can be understood by engineers, analysts, and data scientists.Data Analysis And InsightsWork closely with engineers, analysts, and data scientists to understand the available sources, quality, and analytical capabilities.Leverage data analysis techniques to identify insights that can inform business decisions and drive strategic initiatives.Solution Design And ImplementationCollaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement solutions that address business requirements and drive value.Ensure that the proposed solutions align with best practices, organizational standards, and regulatory requirements.Facilitate communication and knowledge transfer between technical teams and business stakeholders, ensuring understanding of the solution's capabilities and limitations.Project Management And Stakeholder EngagementParticipate and lead project planning to ensure successful delivery of data-driven initiatives.Manage stakeholder expectations and communicate project status, and risks effectively.Foster relationships with business stakeholders, technical teams, and cross-functional partners to promote collaboration and alignment.About The TeamAWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.Diverse ExperiencesAmazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.Why AWSAmazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.Work/Life BalanceWe value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.Inclusive Team CultureHere at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.Mentorship and Career GrowthWe’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:Arlington, VA, USA | Austin, TX, USA | Chicago, IL, USA | Dallas, TX, USA | Denver, CO, USA | Los Angeles, CA, USA | New Jersey, NJ, USA | New York City, NY, USA | San Francisco, CA, USA | Seattle, WA, USABasic Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field; advanced degree is preferred. 3+ experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in a data-driven environment, with a solid understanding of data analysis techniques and methodologies. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to break down complex business problems into manageable components. 2+ years of experience in data modeling, data warehousing, and business intelligence tools and concepts. 2+ years Experience with project management methodologies and tools (e.g., Agile, Scrum)Preferred Qualifications Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and vice versa. Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multitask effectively.Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $64,500/year in our lowest geographic market up to $155,200/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.Company - Amazon Web Services, Inc. - A97Job ID: A2600185

title: Product Analyst
job_description: At Aline, we are committed to revolutionizing the senior living management technology market by continuously elevating our offerings and ensuring exceptional user experiences. In line with this commitment, we are seeking a dedicated Product Analyst to join our vibrant team. This role is designed for a dynamic individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is passionate about making a tangible impact through our products and services. The Product Analyst is crucial in driving our product development and project management efforts, offering extensive support across the entire product lifecycle. From requirements gathering to implementation and beyond, this role demands a blend of technical acumen, customer-centric focus, and innovative thinking. Join us in our mission to enhance the lives of seniors and their caregivers by delivering cutting-edge solutions and fostering meaningful engagements.The Product Analyst plays a pivotal role within the organization by offering comprehensive product and project support, facilitating client coordination, and providing invaluable subject matter expertise. Engaged throughout the entire product life cycle, this individual contributes to key phases including requirements gathering, testing, implementation, and ongoing support.ResponsibilitiesGather and analyze user requirements, business needs, and technical specifications to understand the scope and objectives of software products.Collaborate with stakeholders to define product features, functionalities, and priorities.Conduct market research to identify trends, competitive landscape, and user preferences.Work closely with UX designers to create intuitive and user-friendly software interfaces.Document detailed functional requirements, use cases, and user stories.Partner with stakeholder groups to understand business needs and identify new solutions for improving business processes.Prepare user manuals, release notes, and other documentation to support product deployment and usage.Perform application troubleshooting and problem-solving.Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) such as user adoption, utilization of new features, and revenue-driven metrics.Evaluate feedback from users, stakeholders, and internal teams to identify areas for product enhancement.Complete user acceptance and stress testing on new product features & functionality.Support the Implementation Team with new customer onboarding.May perform other duties as needed and/or assigned. RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field. Equivalent experience will be considered.Minimum of three (3) years of experience as a Product Analyst, Business Analyst, or similar role, preferably within a software development or technology-driven environment.Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and other relevant productivity tools.Exceptional customer service skills with a focus on understanding and addressing user needs.Strong analytical abilities with the capability to prioritize tasks, plan effectively, and solve complex problems.Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.Demonstrated time management and prioritization skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and adapt to changing priorities in a dynamic environment.Strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality results.Ability to work independently with minimal supervision while also functioning well within a team environment.Familiarity with SQL Server Management Studio or other database management tools is a plus.Experience working in Agile methodologies, including Scrum or Kanban.Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO®) is a plus.Experience working with JIRA is a plus.Apply Now

title: Sr Analyst, Business Process
job_description: Be unstoppable with us!T-Mobile is synonymous with innovation–and you could be part of the team that disrupted an entire industry! We reinvented customer service, brought real 5G to the nation, and now we’re shaping the future of technology in wireless and beyond. Our work is as exciting as it is rewarding, so consider the career opportunity below as your invitation to grow with us, make big things happen with us, above all, #BEYOU with us. Together, we won’t stop!Are you a self-driven analyst that is excited about learning, wearing multiple hats and is a champion for change? Are you motivated about developing and implementing innovative ideas? The Sr. Analyst of Business process will be responsible for developing, re-engineering, improving, and maintaining training modules, and frontline content to support the Credit Underwriting and Credit Manual Review business goals.Job Responsibilities:Design end to end processes by identifying, analyzing, prioritizing, documenting and implementing policy and procedure improvements (new or existing), not limited to tools and methods that are repeatable and sustainable. Provide proactive, frequent, and regular communication to all impacted teams, cross-functional teams including Credit Leadership. This also includes project readouts of risks, issues, and impacts to timelines.Solves complex, varied problems facing day-to-day operations; deliver simplified solutions that allow the department to seamlessly provide customer service excellence.Proactively identify potential issues as a departmental guide and collaborate with cross-functional partners to mitigate issues and risks by planning/implementing solutions with a sense of urgency. Use extensive knowledge of T-Mobile’s policies and systems to scope proposed changes and potential impacts to the department and customers. Communicate changes to the department. Foster relationships with key cross-functional partners and internal collaborators, and develop strong partnerships to obtain results on behalf of the departmentAlign policy, procedure and process with other lines of business to ensure consistent customer service experience.As an owner, you will manage C2/SharePoint updates and revisions with collaboration from Credit & Collections business owners and management to ensure active procedures are accurate. Serves as point of contact for the Credit organization for all CUW and Customer Verification related policies and C2/SharePoint content.Create and deliver all new hire and continuing education training curriculum for new and tenured Credit Underwriters and Credit Manual Review analysts (not limited to CUW and CV). Partners with management to ensure all employees have the proper tools, training, and coaching environment to be successful in their roles. Serves in a consulting or subject matter expert capacity on Credit related initiatives driven by Credit or Enterprise to ensure a successful rollout. Could be responsible for the oversight of other subgroups/teams, tasks, activities, deliverables, and timelines to accomplish project objectives that impact CreditResponsible for execution of User Acceptance Testing, which includes writing test cases for internally driven projectsEducation:Bachelor's Degree required. Master's degree preferredWork Experience:4-7 years related work experience in project management, business process or related field. Strong communications skills both written and verbal requiredOutstanding analytical, organizational, and project management skills with strong attention to detail required.MS Project required.Training development and facilitation highly preferredArticulate 360 preferredInstructional design experience preferred.Microsoft Office Skills required.Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with ambiguity required. At least 18 years of age Legally authorized to work in the United StatesColorado Pay Range: $84,500.00 - $114,400.00The pay range above is the general base pay range for a successful candidate in the state listed. The successful candidate’s actual pay will be based on various factors, such as work location, qualifications, and experience, so the actual starting pay may be above or below this range. At T-Mobile, employees in regular, non-temporary roles are eligible for an annual bonus or periodic sales incentive or bonus, based on their role. Most Corporate employees are eligible for a year-end bonus based on company and/or individual performance and which is set at a percentage of the employee’s eligible earnings in the prior year. Certain positions in Customer Care are eligible for monthly bonuses based on individual and/or team performance, while Retail and Business Sales roles are eligible for monthly or quarterly sales incentives. And since we are ALL owners, EVERY employee at T-Mobile is eligible for an Annual Stock Grant. For information about T-Mobile’s amazing benefits, check out https://careers.t-mobile.com/culture-and-benefits/ Travel:Travel Required (Yes/No):NoDOT Regulated:DOT Regulated Position (Yes/No):NoSafety Sensitive Position (Yes/No):NoAt T-Mobile, our benefits exemplify the spirit of One Team, Together! A big part of how we care for one another is working to ensure our benefits evolve to meet the needs of our team members. Full and part-time employees have access to the same benefits when eligible. We cover all of the bases, offering medical, dental and vision insurance, a flexible spending account, 401(k), employee stock grants, employee stock purchase plan, paid time off and up to paid 12 holidays - which total about 4 weeks for new full-time employees and about 2.5 weeks for new part-time employees annually - paid parental and family leave, family building benefits, back-up care, enhanced family support, childcare subsidy, tuition assistance, college coaching, short and long term disability, voluntary AD&D coverage, voluntary accident coverage, voluntary life insurance, voluntary disability insurance, and voluntary long-term care insurance.We don't stop there- eligible employees can receive mobile service & home internet discounts, pet insurance, and access to commuter and transit programs! To learn about T-Mobile’s amazing benefits, check out www.t-mobilebenefits.com. Never stop growing!T-Mobile doesn’t have a corporate ladder–it’s more like a jungle gym of possibilities! We love helping our employees grow in their careers, because it’s that shared drive to aim high that drives our business and our culture forward.T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, religious affiliation, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination, retaliation or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with how we do business and will not be tolerated.Talent comes in all forms at the Un-carrier. If you are an individual with a disability and need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know by emailing ApplicantAccommodation@t-mobile.com or calling 1-844-873-9500. title: Operational Excellence Business Analyst
job_description: Description:The Operational Excellence SOP Specialist will be focused on implementing standardization techniques across the Greeley Beef Facility. The ideal candidate will have strong written and verbal communication skills, the ability to work effectively with various departments, and a strong sense of determination.Responsibilities:Accurately track Key Performance Indicators on a weekly basis, as well as effectively communicate and follow up on KPI performance and action plans for various departments.Write SOP’s for operational tasks across the facility using SDCA methodology.Work closely with Safety and Maintenance departments to standardize Job Safety Analyses.Aid in the success of the current 5S Program and 5S Pilot Areas.Support Operational Excellence Manager in various projects, SDCA, RCA, PDCA exercises, cost savings initiatives, etc.Responsible for updating visual management throughout the facility.Qualifications:Must have strong computer proficiency (specifically Microsoft Excel)Strong attention to detailGood organizational skillsExcellent oral and written communication skillsStrong understanding of continuous improvement methodologyWillingness to learn and adaptAbility to work in fast paced, changing environmentStrong critical thinking and problem solving skillsAbility to work 50+ hours/weekThe applicant who fills this position will be eligible for the following compensation and benefits:Benefits: Vision, Medical, and Dental coverage begin after 60 days of employment;Paid Time off: sick leave, vacation and 6 company observed holidays;401(k): eligible after the 1st day of employment including company match which begins after the first year of service and follows the company vesting scheduleBase salary range of $51,713 - $67,200This position is eligible to participate in the Company’s annual bonus plan; the amount of bonus varies and is subject to the standard terms and conditions of the incentive program;The company is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our team members and visitors. title: Business Operations Analyst II
job_description: Company SummaryDISH, an EchoStar Company, has been reimagining the future of connectivity for more than 40 years. Our business reach spans satellite television service, live-streaming and on-demand programming, smart home installation services, mobile plans and products, and now we are building America’s First Smart Network™.Today, our brands include EchoStar, Hughes, DISH TV, Sling TV, Boost Infinite, Boost Mobile, DISH Wireless, OnTech and GenMobile.Department SummaryOur Manufacturing teams are the gatekeepers who ensure our groundbreaking products meet the standards of innovation and performance we pride ourselves on. From the engineers who design large-scale production systems and cutting-edge quality assurance tools to the hands-on associates who manage our massive inventory flow, they make up a diverse group of behind-the-scenes thinkers dedicated to the success of our organization.Job Duties And Responsibilities Key Responsibilities:  Work with internal teams such as accounting, finance, manufacturing and distribution to develop reports useful in understanding freight costs and patterns  Respond to carrier inquiries about operational issues and find long-term solutions  Assist internal teams with shipping and logistics processes  Develop reporting to ensure Dish employees are adhering to business rules regarding shipping  Analyze transportation data to look for opportunities to improve processes and recommend best practices  Participate in quarterly business reviews with our freight payment vendor and transportation partners as necessary  Assist internal teams with other tasks as needed which may include data entry, reporting and analysis, partner management, and more Skills, Experience And Requirements Education and Experience:  Bachelor's degree (B. A. or B. S.) from a four-year college or university  2+ years of experience working in transportation with freight carriers (truckload and LTL) and/or parcel carriers  1+ years of data analysis experience in a manufacturing or logistics environment Skills And Qualifications Advanced skills and experience with Excel  Prior experience maintaining TMS platforms  Exceptional problem-solving skills and ability to find opportunities for improving efficiency  Ability to convey findings from complex data sets with use of easy to understand charts, graphs, and observations  Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to communicate complex data clearly and concisely to department leadership and executives  Ability to facilitate meetings with partners, stakeholder and leadership  Familiarity with SQL and ability to write basic queries Salary RangesCompensation: $63,150.00/Year - $90,000.00/YearBenefitsWe offer versatile health perks, including flexible spending accounts, HSA, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, career opportunities and a flexible time away plan; all benefits can be viewed here: DISH Benefits .The base pay range shown is a guideline. Individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level and competencies; compensation is based on the role's location and is subject to change based on work location. Candidates need to successfully complete a pre-employment screen, which may include a drug test and DMV check.This will be posted for a minimum of 3 days or until the position is filled.

title: ECMC Senior Business Process Analyst - Deadline Extended 5/1/2024.
job_description: Department InformationThis posting is only open to residents of the State of Colorado at the time of submitting your application.Deadline Extended 5/1/2024**Are you interested in investing in a career that makes a difference?Consider joining the dedicated people of the Colorado Department of Natural Resources. It’s our mission to manage and conserve Colorado’s natural resources for the benefit of people today – and tomorrow. That means we have to balance development with conservation so the state we all love provides similar opportunities for our children and their children.We invite you to explore our website at https://dnr.colorado.gov/about-us to find out more about the work we do to manage Colorado’s natural resources for today – and tomorrow.The State of Colorado believes that equity, diversity, and inclusion drive our success, and we encourage candidates from all identities, backgrounds, and abilities to apply.In Addition To Offering Rewarding, Meaningful Work, We OfferMedical and Dental plansStrong, flexible retirement plans including PERA Defined Benefit Plan or PERA Defined Contribution Plan, plus pre-tax 401K and 457 plansPaid life insuranceShort- and long-term disability coverageEmployee Wellness programsFlexible Spending AccountsHealth Savings Accounts11 paid holidays per year plus generous vacation and sick leaveFlexible work schedule options and remote-work options Career advancement opportunities throughout the State system Some positions may qualify for the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program. For more information, go to: https://studentloans.gov/myDirectLoan/pslfFlow.action#!/pslf/launchAbout Colorado Energy & Carbon Management Commission (ECMC)The mission of the Colorado Energy & Carbon Management Commission (ECMC) is to regulate the development and production of oil and gas, deep geothermal resources, the capture and sequestration of carbon, and the underground storage of natural gas in a manner that protects public health, safety, welfare, the environment and wildlife resources.The Personnel and Strategic Planning (PSP) Unit is responsible for managing the strategic development of the organization, including development of strategic plans and projects, identifying the need for additional positions, and developing leadership, organizational resilience, and succession planning. This unit is also responsible for the administration and development of personnel, including recruitment, salary administration, performance planning, employee development, training and performance improvement. It also provides general administrative assistance and recommendations to the Director, Deputy Directors, Commissioners, and other stakeholders.Description Of JobThis posting is only open to residents of the State of Colorado at the time of submitting your application.Position Summary:  In order to plan and implement a strategic roadmap for ECMC, it is critical that all of the current processes and procedures of the organization are located, mapped, and updated as improvements are made. This position will be the ECMC staff authority for business process mapping which will directly inform all strategic planning including the development of a Strategic Roadmap for the Commission.Business Process Mapping Will Allow ECMC a Deep Understanding Of All ECMC Business Processes Which Will Provide The Information Needed For The PSP Unit To Determine the ‘current state’ of ECMC business processes  Utilize process mapping, requirements gathering, design evaluation, and testing to implement solutions for ECMC future state initiatives  Determine which business processes are deficient or need improvement  Develop a comprehensive strategic roadmap to optimize business processes  Liaise between all ECMC units in strategic planning integration Map and Maintain all ECMC Business Processe s : This position will look to collect data points and streamline processes based on the Commission's mission. Create process mapping processes and procedures including selecting mapping software, identifying key stakeholders, meeting with various staff to walk though all current state of all business processes, and soliciting feedback from various ECMC staff in various feedback loops  Work with PSP Manager and other leadership to create ECMC Strategic Roadmap for the Commission  Lead multiple strategic project activities simultaneously, working with internal and external cross-functional groups  Gain a deep understanding of business implications and incorporate that understanding into technical and process improvement recommendations  Use project management software and other software visualizations to show ECMC process integration among units and workstreams  Construct and adhere to project plans, identify dependencies and resource requirements, communicate project status, escalate issues, and manage timelines and action items  Work closely and collaborate with the PSP Manager and leadership team members to ensure a prioritized and sufficient strategic plan  Actively engage and educate business process owners on solution optimization, simplification, and standardization capabilities  Foster a diverse workplace that enables all participants to contribute to their full potential in pursuit of organizational and strategic objectives  Create a process update and document control framework that includes adherence to all CO State accessibility laws and standards Work with business process owners to continuously update all ECMC process when there are:  Changes identified by process owners  New systems or processes are added to through legislation or technology evolution  Business processes change due to strategic initiatives  Deletion or outdated or ineffective processes Use Business Process Data to Create and Maintain ECMC Strategic Roadmap : This Position Will Work With The PSP Manager To Use the data provided through the business processing analyses to create a robust five-year ECMC Strategic Roadmap  Present ECMC’s Strategic Roadmap to various stakeholders including ECMC Leadership and staff, Commissioners, and other Department of Natural Resources stakeholders  Demonstrate excellence in business process modeling  Work with communications staff to develop pertinent communications needed to support all Roadmap initiatives  Use Asana project management software to develop strategic roadmap projects and initiatives and assign and delegate tasks to stakeholders  Conduct regular check ins with project stakeholders  Provide written and verbal feedback to stakeholders on strategic project work  Write and present detailed reports regarding strategic plan work  Comply with all Colorado Accessibility Standards in all work products Act as a Liaison Between IT, Quality Assurance, Finance, and Operations Groups :  Act as a liaison between business, quality assurance, and operations groups by having regular cadence meetings with key stakeholders and incorporating IT and quality assurance needs in all strategic planning work  Making key recommendations to IT, quality assurance, finance, and other units related to business process improvements  Work with key stakeholders in other units to supervise the design of new products and evaluate how these will perform for ECMC  Determine business needs based on liaison work with other units Other Duties Assigned.Minimum Qualifications, Substitutions, Conditions Of Employment & Appeal RightsThis posting is only open to residents of the State of Colorado at the time of submitting your application.Minimum QualificationsSeven (7) years of professional experience in an occupational field related to the work assigned to the position. At least five years of experience in business process and technology projects AND a t least two years of process Improvement, analysis and facilitation experienceORThree (3) years of professional experience in an occupational field with experience in business process and technology projects, process Improvement, analysis and facilitation experience .ANDBachelor's degree from an accredited institution in Business Administration, Management, Organizational Development, Human Resources, or related field.Substitutions: Additional appropriate experience will substitute for the degree requirement on a year-for-year basis. Additional appropriate education will substitute for the required experience on a year-for-year basis. Please note : The required experience must be substantiated within the work experience section of your application. Your resume will not be reviewed to determine if you meet the minimum qualifications; only the work experience section of your application will be reviewed to determine this. “See Resume” statements on the application will not be accepted. In addition, part-time work will be prorated.Required Competencies Expertise in gathering and analyzing process-related metrics.  High level of expertise mapping and modeling organizational and business processes  Expertise with productivity tools such as Microsoft Office, Visio, LucidChart and database tools such as Tableau and SQL  Preferred Qualifications: Excellent verbal and written communication skills  Expertise with MS Office, Google Suite, Adobe, Zoom, Asana or other project management software, and survey software. Current or former State experience relevant to this position. Strong organizational skills.  Excellent problem solving logic.  Motivated team player with well developed people skills.  Experience leading staff.  Strong knowledge base of BPM (business process methods), techniques, and tools such as Lean Six Sigma.  Current or former State experience relevant to this position.  Working with the general public, professional consultants, and ECMC and DNR staff, with sensitivity to their needs, priorities and commitments. Conditions of Employment:Must be willing and able to possess and maintain a State of Colorado Driver's License.Must be willing and able to travel to out of town hearings of the ECMC.May be required to work in other parts of the State for short periods of time. You must be legally eligible to work in the United States to be appointed to this position. DNR does not sponsor non-residents of the United States. The current work arrangement for this position is as follows:(Please note, this arrangement can be subject to change) This is a Hybrid position - Work is primarily performed from a home office, however the selected candidate will at times report to the office at 1120 Lincoln St, Denver, CO 80203, USA for meetings, trainings and projects as directed by the supervisor. Supplemental InformationThe Assessment Process All applications received by the closing of this announcement will be reviewed by an HR Specialist against the Minimum Qualifications in this announcement.  Colorado Revised Statutes require that state employees are hired and promoted based on merit and fitness through a comparative analysis process. Part of, or all of, the comparative analysis for this position will be a structured application review by Subject Matter Experts.  Resumes, cover letters and other attachments are not considered as part of initial reviews, therefore, it is important to document in your application your education, experience, minimum qualifications, and preferred qualifications as outlined in the job announcement.  Please thoroughly answer all supplemental questions (if listed) since question responses may be evaluated for content, writing ability, spelling, grammar, and effective communication.  This recruitment may involve additional testing and/or exams to arrive at the top group for interviews. Equity, Diversity, and InclusionThe State of Colorado believes that equity, diversity, and inclusion drive our success, and we encourage candidates from all identities, backgrounds, and abilities to apply. Understand external influencers· Articulate business goals and objectives. Determine the solution scope. title: Strategy & Operations Analyst, Capital IQ Solutions
job_description: About the Role: Grade Level (for internal use): 11 The Team: The Capital IQ Solutions team is comprised of world class people with a shared mission of enabling client workflows within the capital markets and corporate segments to support accurate and efficient research, analysis and decision making. Responsibilities and Impact: The Strategy & Operations Senior Associate will work within, and alongside the leadership team, of the Capital IQ Solutions organization. This role will assist in building reports and presentations for the Capital IQ Solutions team, as well as progressing strategic programs, and using data and analytics to support decision-making. A successful candidate in this roll will be a self-starter and team player, be intellectually curious, and have strong analytical skills - both technically with data and qualitatively drawing actionable insights and conclusions from their work - and be able to communicate them clearly to the management team and cross-functionally. Responsibilities include: Develop presentations and reporting for internal strategic meetings, industry events attended by members of the Capital IQ Solutions leadership teams, Board of Directors meetings, financial performance reviews and other similar needs Support strategy formulation and execution, special strategic projects, and business development activities by providing actionable analysis Aggregate & analyze data from different sources, manage reporting, mine insights for the team, and drive improvements in business initiatives Partner with cross-functional teams including business management, sales, people partners, finance and accounting, among others, to drive progress on strategic programs Develop product and business line analyses to understand internal and external drivers and to facilitate better business decisions Understand markets, competitors and emerging companies that impact the Capital IQ Solutions business and product offerings, support M&A target development Organize training materials and team activities/events to facilitate collaboration and development Qualifications Bachelors degree; business and/or finance preferred 3-5 years of prior experience in a strategic and/or analytical role within a consulting firm, investment bank, private equity firm, and/or financial technology company Proficiency in Microsoft Office; particularly PowerPoint, Excel; Salesforce experience is a plus Unmatched attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple workstreams without sacrificing quality Curiosity and demonstrated ability to analyze data and develop meaningful commentary explaining trends in our business Ability to craft compelling story that drives business understanding and outcomes Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with ability to lead and influence internal stakeholders Proven effectiveness and comfort working with stakeholders (both internal and external) at different levels of the organization Demonstrated ability to self-direct and be proactive with a strong business sense, and accountability to meet deadlines Compensation/Benefits Information (US Applicants Only): S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $70,000 to $120,000Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location. In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for additional compensation such as an annual incentive bonus. This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhiresRight to Work Requirements: This role is limited to persons with indefinite right to work in the United States. Return to Work: Have you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return to Work initiative, Restart, we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace About S&P Global Market Intelligence At S&P Global Market Intelligence, a division of S&P Global we understand the importance of accurate, deep and insightful information. Our team of experts delivers unrivaled insights and leading data and technology solutions, partnering with customers to expand their perspective, operate with confidence, and make decisions with conviction. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/marketintelligenceWhat's In It For You? Our Purpose: Progress is not a self-starter. It requires a catalyst to be set in motion. Information, imagination, people, technology-the right combination can unlock possibility and change the world. Our world is in transition and getting more complex by the day. We push past expected observations and seek out new levels of understanding so that we can help companies, governments and individuals make an impact on tomorrow. At S&P Global we transform data into Essential Intelligence, pinpointing risks and opening possibilities. We Accelerate Progress. Our People: We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide-so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all. From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We're committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. We're constantly seeking new solutions that have progress in mind. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference. Our Values: Integrity, Discovery, Partnership At S&P Global, we focus on Powering Global Markets. Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals. Benefits: We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That's why we provide everything you-and your career-need to thrive at S&P Global. Our benefits include: Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body. Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on. Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills. Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs. Family Friendly Perks: It's not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families. Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards-small perks can make a big difference. For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at S&P Global: At S&P Global, we believe diversity fuels creative insights, equity unlocks opportunity, and inclusion drives growth and innovationPowering Global Markets. Our commitment centers on our global workforce, ensuring that our people are empowered to bring their whole selves to work. It doesn't stop there, we strive to better reflect and serve the communities in which we live and work, and advocate for greater opportunity for all. Equal Opportunity Employer S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment. If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person. title: SAP Business Analyst Level 3
job_description: Job DescriptionAs a Manufacturing Engineering (ME) Business Analyst supporting SAP and MES (Apriso) production planning applications for the Space business area, the employee will facilitate the development, implementation and sustainment of the manufacturing execution system and processes to include interfaces with our ERP and PLM systems. The employee will work across multiple project teams to optimize engineering and manufacturing bill of material and work instruction processes working directly with both our Space shop floor users and our IT team to translate requirements, resolve errors, and improve processes.RequirementsDemonstrated experience in the following:Strong Apriso production planning, quality/nonconformance and manufacturing execution experience (5+ years), including configuring the Apriso system.Quality, manufacturing engineering and shop floor execution process knowledge is also desired.5+ years configuration experience Apriso with ability to configure and customize configurations in manufacturing execution systemMinimum 3+ years experience supporting full cycle implementation, which includes Gap Analysis, Requirements gathering, blueprinting, Development, Testing, Reporting, Go-live and Post Go-live support.Demonstrated experience in writing functional specifications, creating test plans and test scripts and performing system integration testing.Integral knowledge in manufacturing work instructions, production order buy off, and shop floor management.Demonstrated problem solving and troubleshooting skillsPrior experience in manufacturing engineering processes including ability to create and manage engineering and manufacturing bill of materials and manufacturing work instructionsExperience with manufacturing engineering change processesDemonstrated analytic skills in analyzing large production, capacity, MRP related data.Ability to adapt business processes into automated tools and techniquesUnderstanding of software agile development lifecycle, and the implementation of user requirements into the environment via definition, testing, implementation and trainingEffective communication and facilitation skills - ability to converse technically and functionallyExcellent documentation skills writing Functional Specification and performing Unit tests/Integration tests.Desired SkillsAbility to perform manufacturing engineering processes in Apriso and SAP ERP (Change Management, Bill of material management, and Manufacturing Work Instructions)Ability to create and manage visual work instructionsSAP and Apriso implementation experience within the production business processesExperience with SAP S4Experience in AprisoExperience in quality engineeringExperience in model based engineeringExperience in the deployment of manufacturing execution systems to include automation techniques, security, and project managementExperience in IT agile development practicesICONMA’s Discrimination DisclaimerAs an equal opportunity employer, ICONMA provides an employment environment that supports and encourages the abilities of all persons without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

title: BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT ANALYST
job_description: Benefits InformationThis job posting is anticipated to remain open until April 29th, 2024. We excel at proving technological solutions to over 1,000 agencies nationwide and allowing those agencies to fulfill their missions without worrying about the technical complexities.QualificationsMinimum RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Criminal Justice or related field, or equivalent experience.At least five (5) years of sales, marketing, or lead generation experience.Valid state driver’s license and the ability to safely operate a motor vehicle for on-site customer visits and other required travel. Prior experience with criminal justice and treatment systems at the local, state or federal level preferred.Experience with Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software. Experience with Salesforce.com preferred.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to establish and maintain customer relationships. Collaborative abilities with cross-functional team management proficiency.Well-developed reasoning, problem-solving, critical thinking and analytical skills and abilities.Ability to manage multiple assignments simultaneously and to prioritize appropriately with focus on meeting all deliverables, timelines and sales goals.Extraordinary attention to detail with minimal error rates.Ability to do research, interview Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) and create high quality sales contact.Proficiency using MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) required. Ability to quickly learn other software, such as Adobe in Design.Ability to quickly develop working knowledge of Company products and services and to clearly explain all capabilities and benefits.Ability to work independently.Understanding of criminal justice and treatment systems at the local, state and federal levels.Proficient with negotiation, presentation and meeting facilitation skills.Proficient business writing skills.Excellent facilitation, organization, and time management skills, including the ability to schedule and manage the entire sales lifecycle and related processes.Ability to think strategically regarding sales opportunities and penetration of new markets.Ability to work with computers and the necessary software typically used by the department.BI IncorporatedResponsibilitiesSummaryProvides research, planning and support with procurements and other opportunities for the Partnership Development Team utilizing research of federal, state and local jurisdictions to improve retention of existing accounts and secure new business. Works directly to support the Development, Proposals and Finance Teams to contribute to overall business strategey.Primary Duties And ResponsibilitiesOversees and handles the Administration of CRM (Salesforce or other software platforms). Works closely with the Partnership Development (Sales) Team to ensure CRM is being fully utilized to manage, plan, and report on Sales opportunities. Provides necessary training to all Salesforce users and Management, as needed.Oversees all changes to Salesforce including updates, and mapping of all custom objects and flows in Salesforce. Analyzes current sales and account management processes and recommend improvements, leveraging Salesforce functionalities.Generates reports and insights from Salesforce to help the Sales team focus potential accounts and opportunities.Manages the Proposal entries and revenue reports for accuracy and continued tracking for Management. Maintains market pricing, research and public records reports in Salesforce. Researches and tracks criminal justice jurisdictions nationwide to identify customer needs and develop strategic sales approaches via direct or partner relationships.Collaborates with Partnership Development Directors, the Proposal Director and the Marketing Team to execute strategic sales research and activities.Coordinates internal efforts for launch of new products and services between PDD Team and training, contracts, monitoring, finance and other related departments. Completes statistical analysis regularly and reporting for senior management on a monthly, quarterly or as needed basis. This includes ad hoc reporting, quarterly and annual business reports for Sales and ad hoc reports for departments outside of Sales as needed. Engages existing customers and local partners to identify local criminal justice jurisdictions for potential sales campaigns. Communicates the features and benefits of Company products and services available to meet customer needs.Arranges and participates in on-site customer visits, sales presentations and trade conferences to educate customers about the features and benefits of Company products and services.Passes leads onto Partnership Development Directors and local partners to ensure follow up.Manages, tracks and reports on sales opportunities and conversions resulting for job efforts using Salesforce.com.Performs other duties as assigned.

title: Business Analyst - NISSC
job_description: ADV0008MPYour ImpactChallenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships.At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world.Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.Jacobs is seeking a Business Analyst to support the NISSC II contract at NORAD. Your career at Jacobs enables NISSC to fulfill its mission to “provide classified communications and processing for Command and Control (C2) capability in organizational work centers at NISSC sites.” As a member of our team, you will support corporate and customer mission to provide world-class IT services and support that connects systems and users across NORAD in the areas of software development/maintenance, network services, cyber security, systems administration, and other mission-critical areas.Job DescriptionThe Business Analyst is responsible for business administration tasks. Reporting to the Contracts/Subcontracts Manager, the individual will perform or support the following activities Work with the Business and Contracts Office as a member of a cohesive and effective team. Communicate contract and subcontract requirements to other functional departments. Support financial reviews, time reporting, invoicing, and auditing activities. Support request for proposals (RFPs) for contracts and subcontracts. Support the development, and processing of Non-Disclosure Agreements (NDAs) Support the administration of teaming agreements and various contract and subcontract instruments. Process Wide Area Work Flow (WAWF) and GSA Invoicing Assist with General Ledger Reconciliation Support process improvements and special projects.Typical Duties Include Provide support to business and operations units in the formation of financial reports, contracts, and subcontracts, including participating in audits, proposal development, subcontract review, and/or subcontract partnering, and risk assessment process. Advise the team on the contractual significance of proposed actions. Review and process proposal requests, contract documents, prepare and provide contractual communications and notices. Review and process Teammate and subcontract agreements, amendments, invoices, and communications and notices. Coordinate with other project team members to identify customer related actions or inactions, which result in constructive contract changes. Coordinate with the Legal, Insurance, Risk, Project Controls, and Business Office on contractual terms and risk issues. Review project correspondence to ensure clients’ rights are protected and that it is consistent with the terms of the prime contract and associated subcontracts. Develop contract summary and update throughout the project. Support compliance with vital records and relevant correspondence to support reporting, contract audit, claims and litigations, and contract close out. Track proposal due dates and develop and maintain schedules with task order teams. title: Strategy & Operations Analyst, Capital IQ Solutions
job_description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  About the Role: Grade Level (for internal use): 11 The Team: The Capital IQ Solutions team is comprised of world class people with a shared mission of enabling client workflows within the capital markets and corporate segments to support accurate and efficient research, analysis and decision making. Responsibilities and Impact: The Strategy & Operations Senior Associate will work within, and alongside the leadership team, of the Capital IQ Solutions organization. This role will assist in building reports and presentations for the Capital IQ Solutions team, as well as progressing strategic programs, and using data and analytics to support decision-making. A successful candidate in this roll will be a self-starter and team player, be intellectually curious, and have strong analytical skills – both technically with data and qualitatively drawing actionable insights and conclusions from their work – and be able to communicate them clearly to the management team and cross-functionally. Responsibilities include: Develop presentations and reporting for internal strategic meetings, industry events attended by members of the Capital IQ Solutions leadership teams, Board of Directors meetings, financial performance reviews and other similar needs Support strategy formulation and execution, special strategic projects, and business development activities by providing actionable analysis Aggregate & analyze data from different sources, manage reporting, mine insights for the team, and drive improvements in business initiatives Partner with cross-functional teams including business management, sales, people partners, finance and accounting, among others, to drive progress on strategic programs Develop product and business line analyses to understand internal and external drivers and to facilitate better business decisions Understand markets, competitors and emerging companies that impact the Capital IQ Solutions business and product offerings, support M&A target development Organize training materials and team activities/events to facilitate collaboration and development Qualifications Bachelors degree; business and/or finance preferred 3-5 years of prior experience in a strategic and/or analytical role within a consulting firm, investment bank, private equity firm, and/or financial technology company Proficiency in Microsoft Office; particularly PowerPoint, Excel; Salesforce experience is a plus Unmatched attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple workstreams without sacrificing quality Curiosity and demonstrated ability to analyze data and develop meaningful commentary explaining trends in our business Ability to craft compelling story that drives business understanding and outcomes Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with ability to lead and influence internal stakeholders Proven effectiveness and comfort working with stakeholders (both internal and external) at different levels of the organization Demonstrated ability to self-direct and be proactive with a strong business sense, and accountability to meet deadlines Compensation/Benefits Information (US Applicants Only): S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $70,000 to $120,000. Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location. In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for additional compensation such as an annual incentive bonus. This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires. Right to Work Requirements: This role is limited to persons with indefinite right to work in the United States. Return to Work: Have you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return to Work initiative, Restart, we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace About S&P Global Market Intelligence At S&P Global Market Intelligence, a division of S&P Global we understand the importance of accurate, deep and insightful information. Our team of experts delivers unrivaled insights and leading data and technology solutions, partnering with customers to expand their perspective, operate with confidence, and make decisions with conviction. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/marketintelligence. What’s In It For You? Our Purpose: Progress is not a self-starter. It requires a catalyst to be set in motion. Information, imagination, people, technology–the right combination can unlock possibility and change the world. Our world is in transition and getting more complex by the day. We push past expected observations and seek out new levels of understanding so that we can help companies, governments and individuals make an impact on tomorrow. At S&P Global we transform data into Essential Intelligence®, pinpointing risks and opening possibilities. We Accelerate Progress. Our People: We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide—so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all. From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We’re committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. We’re constantly seeking new solutions that have progress in mind. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference. Our Values: Integrity, Discovery, Partnership At S&P Global, we focus on Powering Global Markets. Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals. Benefits: We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global. Our benefits include: Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body. Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on. Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills. Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs. Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families. Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference. For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at S&P Global: At S&P Global, we believe diversity fuels creative insights, equity unlocks opportunity, and inclusion drives growth and innovation – Powering Global Markets. Our commitment centers on our global workforce, ensuring that our people are empowered to bring their whole selves to work. It doesn’t stop there, we strive to better reflect and serve the communities in which we live and work, and advocate for greater opportunity for all. ----------------------------------------------------------- Equal Opportunity Employer S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. title: Human Resources Business Intelligence Analyst
job_description: Job DescriptionSalary Range: $88,200 - $123,500Hiring Range: $88,200 - $106,016Job SummaryThe Human Resources Business Intelligence Analyst (HR BI Analyst) will collect, compile, and analyze HR data, metrics, and statistics, and apply this data to make recommendations related to recruitment, retention, and legal compliance. With minimal direction, serves as the data analytics expert reviewing, developing and implementing data driven metrics to improve operational performance within the Human Resources Department. The HR BI Analyst is responsible for identifying areas of concern and providing appropriate recommendations to resolve them to HR leadership.EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE, and SKILLS: (include Education, Certifications, Licenses & Equipment Skills)Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Data Analytics, or related field required.  At least three (3) years of experience in related areas such as data analytics, ERP analytics, job classification and compensation, recruitment, selection, performance management, training, employee benefits, and/or equal opportunity compliance preferred.  At least one (1) year working in Human Resources with Oracle. OR Any combination of related education, experience, certifications and licenses that will result in a candidate successfully performing the essential functions of the job. Preferred Master’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Data Analytics, or related preferred  SPHR, SHRM – SCP, PHR, SHRM-CP, preferred  Four (4) or more years of experience in related areas such as data analytics, ERP analytics, job classification and compensation, recruitment, selection, performance management, training, employee benefits, and/or equal opportunity compliance preferred. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, And ABILITIES Knowledge of the business and organizational structure of Colorado municipalities  Collaboration skills, including the ability to work with others from different areas and backgrounds to reach a common goal  Computer skills, including the ability to utilize Microsoft Office programs (i.e. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.) and learn and experiment with new software and systems  Interpersonal skills, including the ability to facilitate interaction, communication, and teamwork between others  Oral, written, and listening communication skills, including the ability to accurately interpret what others are saying and convey messages, information, concepts, and details accurately and clearly  Organizational skills, including the ability to set and meet goals and deadlines, manage appointments, create schedules, coordinate and facilitate meetings, and make decisions  Ability to work under pressure, manage multiple concurrent and competing tasks and responsibilities, and adapt to changing priorities while maintaining personal effectiveness  Ability to prioritize work, meet deadlines, and stay on task when completing special projects and daily assignments  Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and reliable professional judgment, as well as collaboratively with a team to achieve desired results  Ability to maintain a strong work ethic, positive problem-solving attitude, and enthusiasm for the work performed  Ability to self-start and take initiative in completing daily tasks and special projects  Ability to focus on activities that have the greatest impact on meeting work commitments  Ability to establish and maintain partnerships with a variety of internal and external constituencies  Ability to communicate and work effectively with individuals from diverse backgrounds, cultures, and ages  Ability to navigate a complex political environment  Knowledge of basic statistics and data science  Knowledge of business intelligence tools, principles, and best practices  Knowledge of research concepts, tools, techniques, and best practices  Analytical and problem-solving skills, including the ability to examine and summarize data and trends in order to resolve issues and produce results  Creative skills, including the ability to ask questions, generate new ideas, experiment, make observations, and develop connections between disparate concepts  Evaluative skills, including the ability to assess information for reliability, validity, and relevance  Critical thinking skills, including the ability to identify problems, questions, and assumptions; establish significance; and understand logical connections between ideas  Research skills, including the ability to utilize a variety of tools to ask questions, gather information, and review, analyze, and interpret data  Ability to qualitatively and quantitatively analyze and synthesize complex business information  Ability to perform fit-gap analysis to identify required customizations versus delivered solutions  Ability to resolve issues and develop new ideas and initiatives that improve the performance of the organization  Ability to make and document effective assumptions for the purposes of moving towards resolution Travel Approximately _10_% travel is required ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: (Duties & Responsibilities) Collects and compiles HR metrics and data from a variety of sources including the human resource information system (HRIS) and payroll outputs, management and employee surveys, exit interviews, employment records, government labor statistics, competitors’ practices, and other sources.  Analyzes data and statistics for trends and patterns with attention to recruitment, hiring practices, motivation, turnover, and compliance with employment laws and regulations.  Prepares reports of data results, presenting and explaining findings to senior HR leadership.  Identifies and recommends reasonable short- and long-term goals, milestones, and benchmarks for key performance metrics.  Based on metrics and analysis, makes recommendations for policies and activities to improve the organizational culture including suggestions to attract and hire qualified candidates, to motivate and retain employees, to address staffing issues, and to maintain legal compliance.  May conduct or assist with conducting classification audits to ensure that jobs are properly classified as exempt or nonexempt.  Ensures compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices.  May guide and/or assist with performance, benefit, and compensation review and evaluation processes.  Provides support to Human Resources divisions to identify performance problems and root cause  Provides documentation for identified problems and documents procedures for solving identified problems  Provides ongoing performance analysis for the Human Resources Department  Develops metrics for internal programs that improve the customer experience  Develops and delivers presentations on departmental performance  Performs other duties as assigned.  Assists users with reporting and data analysis.  Opens tickets for IT support with Oracle, and any other vendors being utilized  Researches vendor products to stay current on new and existing functionality  Adheres and reinforces all HR policies, processes, and procedures  Other duties as assigned Supervisory Responsibilities None WORK ENVIRONMENT And PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTSWork Environment:  Position requires extensive time at a computer performing research, and drafting documents and email communications  This is primarily a sedentary position with business conducted in an office setting  Office environment with travel to and appearance in meetings other formal environments  Busy office activity with frequent inflexible deadlines  May be required to drive personal vehicle for business purposes Physical Requirements Position requires extensive time at a computer performing legal research, and drafting documents and email communications  Vision enough to interpret computer screens and documents to assist the public and complete work assignments; specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus  Manual dexterity enough to accurately input, retrieve and verify work assignments; employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms  Light to moderate physical effort that includes frequent standing, walking, keypunching, and oral communication; maintaining arms and hands in the same position for repetitive tasks; frequently works with light objects and light hand tools EOE Statement: The City of Greeley provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. title: Business Support Analyst Senior – Life Company
job_description: Why USAA?Let’s do something that really matters.At USAA, we have an important mission: facilitating the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. Not all of our employees served in our nation’s military, but we all share in the mission to give back to those who did. We’re working as one to build a great experience and make a real impact for our members.We believe in our core values of honesty, integrity, loyalty and service.
