title: SR. RCM BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST
job_description: Our CompanyAmeritaOverviewAmerita is an entrepreneurial-founded company and a wholly owned subsidiary of PharMerica. The home infusion market is positioned for rapid growth driven by the aging population, increase in chronic diseases, robust pipeline of infusible drugs coming to market, and an industry shift from hospital delivery settings to lower-cost, high-quality alternative providers such as Amerita.The Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst, RCM, is a critical role for the Revenue Cycle Organization. This role will accelerate the enablement of reporting and analytics solutions to drive best-in-class Revenue Cycle performance. The ideal candidate for this role is someone who has a blend between technical expertise and business acumen, is a self-starter, strategic thinker, and ultimately one that can translate key business questions into data driven answers. This role will build and delivery key reporting and analytics tool kits for all aspects of Amerita’s Revenue Cycle organization. High-quality, affordable benefits for all Full-time and Part-time Employees Medical, Dental & Vision Benefits plus, HSA & FSA Savings Accounts Supplemental Coverage – Accident, Critical Illness and Hospital Indemnity Insurance 401(k) Retirement Plan with Employer Match Company paid Life and AD&D Insurance, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Employee Discounts Tuition Reimbursement Paid Time Off & HolidaysPosition will be posted for a minimum of 7 business daysResponsibilities Responsible for becoming an expert in the Revenue Cycle processes. Gaining deep understanding for the process will enable the right reporting solutions to be developed.  Conducts intake on new reporting requests and ensures we only build what is going to drive the highest business value, while not duplicating reports/dashboards that are already in place.  Migration of current reporting stack away from excel and into a visualization platform.  Responsible for developing and maintaining performance reporting and dashboards to help leaders make data driven decisions in their respective areas.  Analyze revenue cycle data (billing, cash applications, account receivable, etc.,) to provide insights on trends and recommend solutions based on what is observed in the data.  Works across Revenue Cycle departments to support building business cases for continuous improvements, along with developing the right reporting to support a test and learn environment.  Partner with the technology teams to ensure the reporting and analytics infrastructure is stable and high performing.  Assists with building labor cost reporting to help leaders keep a pulse on their operating cost(s).  Proactively identify automation opportunities and recommend process improvements to enhance system efficiencies.  Contribute to the department goals of meeting key productivity metrics.  Support day-to-day operational needs/requests of the revenue cycle teams.  Monitors usage of reporting solutions to ensure value is being created by the work conducted.  Serve as a data thought partner to Amerita’s senior leadership team. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Analytics, Business Administration, or related field discipline preferred.  Experience with Pharmacy Management/Revenue Cycle Management systems.  4+ years of reporting and analytics experience.  Highly Fluent in SQL and BI Tools (Power BI and/or Tableau).  Accustomed to a fast-paced environment. Behavior Competencies Required: Conduct all matters with the highest standards of integrity and transparency. Posses a strong sense of urgency and exceptional work ethic and able to overcome obstacles to meet timelines. Ability to develop, motivate and build strong teams and achieve superior levels of performance. Possesses initiative and tenacity to exert the commitment to the organization in its vision and mission. Remains calm under pressure.About Our Line Of BusinessAmerita is a specialty infusion company focused on providing complex pharmaceutical products and clinical services to patients outside of the hospital. Committed to excellent service, our vision is to combine the administrative efficiencies of a large organization with the flexibility, responsiveness and entrepreneurial spirit of a local provider. For more information about Amerita, please visit www.ameritaiv.com . Follow us on Twitter and LinkedIn . Salary Range USD $94,700.00 - $100,000.00 / Year

title: Sr. Business Analyst - Financial, Investment or Trading Experience
job_description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, SES, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!Busiess Analyst Type: W2 With Benefits - No C2CLocation: Denver, COTop 5 Technical Skills: Sr. Business Analyst (must "take the ball and run with it") Understanding of Retirement / Trading / Financials (++) SQL (need to be able to query db to get data to create screen shots) Jira Oracle Forms (++)Top 3 Soft Skills: Communications is key Confidence in presentation and discussion skills Strong typing skills (ability to type notes during meetings and keep up with the conversation in creating notes, details, requirements Strong organization (schedule meetings with stakeholders and technical staff, then run the meetings, lead the discussion. Quick learnerJob Description:This Business Analyst must be a Sr-level BA. They will be expected to take the EPICS (100 pts) and break them down into "consumable" requirements. This is a backend heavy, business logic type applications around investment, trades, etc.Role on the Team:This role is key to the success of the team. This BA must be able to take the lead on creating User Stories. They must be able to schedule meetings with all key stakeholders, come to the meeting prepared with what needs to be covered, lead the meetings, take motes in real time, and then create the User Stories for final review. They will then also run the Grooming Session with the developers to get their questions, find answers/clarifications, and present fully consumable User Stories. The developers would then come back to the BA is they have further questions that need to be answered, and this person would quickly find those answers.Benefits:SES hires W2 benefitted and non-benefitted consultants. Our contract employee benefits include group medical dental vision life LT and ST disability insurance, 21 days of accrued paid time off, 401k, tuition reimbursement, performance bonuses, paid overtime, and more. Please contact me to discuss the details of this position further.Please forward resume directly to for immediate consideration - rstarinieri at sesc .comI look forward to speaking with you soon!Robin StarinieriSr. Technical RecruiterSystems Engineering ServicesSr. Business Analyst - Financial, Investment or Trading Experience

title: Technical Analyst- Mortgage Lending or Junior (Depending on Experience)
job_description: Company DescriptionEnt Credit Union exists to improve the financial quality of life of the people we serve. This mission drives us every day, but we are more than our mission. We're also individuals using our unique abilities to make our organization, and the communities we serve, better than they were yesterday. We're a not-for-profit that puts people above profits and actively invests in our community. Our rapidly growing team is expanding our reach to serve more people throughout Colorado. To spread our mission far and wide, we need people like you. If you're interested in a paycheck with a purpose, apply with us today. Our people make the difference, and we truly believe you are our greatest asset.Job DescriptionThe Technical Analyst-Mortgage Lending Junior position partners with the Mortgage Lending Management Team to manage mortgage Loan Origination Systems (LOS), mortgage loan Point of Sale systems (POS), associated applications, and reporting functions. They are responsible to utilize all available resources to remain proficient and knowledgeable on Mortgage Lending associated technologies. Provide direction to Information Technology staff in order to provide a bridge between credit union functions and Mortgage Lending functions. Act as a resource to all credit union management to source data, build complex reports, test calculations, and program application interfaces. This position will develop plans for system improvements, organize resources to ensure maximum automation for efficiency, and manage technology vendor relationships to ensure highest and most consistent performance of current systems. Finally, the Technical Analyst will maintain responsibility to monitor security of information to prevent conflicting functions that expose the credit union to privacy concerns, risk of losses, or compliance violations.The Technical Analyst-Mortgage Lending position partners with the Mortgage Lending Management Team to manage mortgage Loan Origination Systems, associated applications, and reporting functions. They are responsible for utilizing all available resources to remain proficient and knowledgeable on Mortgage lending-associated technologies. Provide direction to Information Technology staff in order to provide a bridge between credit union functions and Mortgage Lending functions. Act as a resource to all credit union management to source data, build complex reports, test calculations, and program application interfaces. This position will develop plans for system improvements, organize resources to ensure maximum automation for efficiency and manage technology vendor relationships to ensure the highest and most consistent performance of current systems. Finally, the Technical Analyst will maintain a responsibility to monitor the security of information to prevent conflicting functions that expose the credit union to privacy concerns, risk of losses, or compliance violations.Essential Functions at the Technical Analyst-Mortgage Lending Junior level:Utilize a help desk ticket tracking system to prioritize, monitor, document progress on projects/critical issues, and provide reports for later analysis. Complete entry level tickets as assigned including but not limited to new hire onboarding system access, termination of mortgage system permissions and password resets. Generate daily, weekly, and monthly reporting. Assist with various recurring projects to include Disaster Recovery responsibilities, control of system and data security, and partnering with internal peers to ensure compliance. This includes semi-annual user audits for all mortgage systems. Assist with coordinating implementation and testing of mortgage system releases, upgrades and service packs. Provide technical analysis and maintain overall compliance/security of information and assets, direct IT partners, technology vendors, and project teams in conjunction with management. Develop and maintain relationships with technology vendors, industry peers, and credit union management in order to manage technology projects, resources, data, security, and operations. This may include research, testing and implementation of new/emerging software. Essential Functions at the Technical Analyst-Mortgage Lending level:Provide technical analysis and maintain overall compliance/security of information and assets, direct IT partners, technology vendors, and project teams in conjunction with management. Utilize a help desk ticket tracking system to prioritize, monitor, document progress on projects/critical issues, and provide reports for later analysis. Directs various recurring projects to include Disaster Recovery responsibilities, control of system and data security, and partnering with Credit/Compliance Administrator to ensure compliance. Develop and maintain relationships with technology vendors, industry peers, and credit union management in order to manage technology projects, resources, data, security, and operations. This may include research, testing and implementation of new/emerging software. Bank Secrecy Act: Remains cognizant of and adheres to Ent policies and procedures, and regulations pertaining to the Bank Secrecy Act. QualificationsMinimum Formal Qualifications at the Technical Analyst-Mortgage Lending Junior level:Associate's Degree in Business Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Administration, or other related field1+ years’ combined mortgage loan servicing, mortgage loan processing/closing, and/or systems administration / technical experience relevant to mortgage lending systems. Minimum Formal Qualifications at the Technical Analyst-Mortgage Lending level:Associate's Degree in Business Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Administration, or other related field2+ years' combined mortgage loan servicing, mortgage loan processing/closing, and/or systems administration / technical experience relevant to mortgage lending systems to include:1+ years must be directly related to systems administration / technical experience relevant to mortgage lending systemsEach year of relevant work experience may be exchanged for a year in a relevant degree program or vice versa. For example, a requirement of a bachelor's degree in accounting and 2+ years of account experience could be substituted for a high school diploma and 6 years of relevant accounting work experience or a master's degree in accounting and 0 years of work experience.Technical or Specialized Knowledge/Skills at the Technical Analyst-Mortgage Lending Junior level:Ability to develop system electronic data interfaces for the transmission of data to relevant vendors or internal systems. Basic technical acumen in relational database design / business intelligence concepts for use in custom report design through Crystal Reports, Microsoft Access, and reporting systems inherent to the lending platforms being used. Data management and analysis skills using various import/export/storage/processing systems. Basic knowledge of Real Estate Lending business – terminology and process flow. A solid understanding of basic user/group security principles and practices. Ability to prioritize/manage assigned projects and allocate pre-approved resources. Strong coordinating and networking skills. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Strong organizational skills. Analytical, technical problem solving, and mathematical ability. Strong Microsoft Office skills to include Excel (including advanced function/formula & pivot table abilities), Word, and Outlook. Data analysis using Microsoft Access is a plus. (Preferred) Experience administrating Encompass, FICS Mortgage Servicer and/or related programs. Technical or Specialized Knowledge/Skills at the Technical Analyst-Mortgage Lending level:Ability to develop system electronic data interfaces for the transmission of data to relevant vendors or internal systems. Excellent technical acumen in relational database design / business intelligence concepts for use in custom report design through Crystal Reports, Microsoft Access, and reporting systems inherent to the lending platforms being used. Data management and analysis skills using various import/export/storage/processing systems. Excellent knowledge of Real Estate Lending business - terminology and process flow. Strong working knowledge administrating Encompass, FICS Mortgage Servicer and/or related programs. A solid understanding of basic user/group security principles and practices. Ability to prioritize/manage projects and allocate resources effectively across different projects as needed. Excellent coordinating and networking skills. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Strong organizational skills. Analytical, technical problem solving, and mathematical ability. Strong Microsoft Office skills to include Excel (including advanced function/formula & pivot table abilities), Word, and Outlook. Data analysis using Microsoft Access is a plus. Certifications Required:NoneEnvironmental, Physical And Psychological RequirementsStanding - OccasionallyWalking - OccasionallySitting - FrequentlyLifting - Rarely (40 Lbs)Carrying - RarelyPushing - RarelyPulling - RarelyBalancing - RarelyStooping - RarelyKneeling - RarelyCrouching - RarelyCrawling - RarelyReaching - OccasionallyHandling - OccasionallyGrasping - OccasionallyFeeling - OccasionallyTalking - FrequentlyHearing - FrequentlyRepetitive Motions - FrequentlyEye/Hand/Foot Coordination - OccasionallyNoises louder than normal speaking volume - OccasionallyTemperature Changes - RarelyAtmospheric Conditions - RarelyAdditional InformationThe pay range at the Technical Analyst-Mortgage Lending Junior level: $22.02 to $28.90 per hour (S13)The pay range at the Technical Analyst-Mortgage Lending level: $26.45 to $33.42 per Hour (S14)Final compensation for this position will be determined by various factors such as relevant work experience, specific skills and competencies, education, certifications, and internal pay equity.This position is eligible for our corporate bonus program based on company performance.We anticipate this position to close on 04/29/2024. Please submit your application at your earliest convenience to be considered.Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.Benefits Summary Sheet - 2024The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Business Data Analyst II - GSA
job_description: MIRACORP Inc.  is a veteran, woman-owned firm specializing in federal government contract services. One competitive advantage is that services provided to customers are provided with unmatched excellence. MIRACORP engages employees as the cornerstone of its success creating constant growth!We are seeking an experienced Business Data Analyst, who has a proven track record of leading a team onsite and able to deliver.Position SummaryWe are seeking a  Business Data Analyst II  to provide federal grant management support for our federal customer, General Services Administration, to perform tasks not limited to finance, accounting, information technology, research and analysis, or other program support fields. This position is located in Lakewood, CO, and does require onsite work.Responsibilities Key Responsibilities include  : Works in support of the general management and business operation of the LCA program, as well as Region 8 Leasing Division.  Provides data analysis and research for specific projects related to Novations, File Reviews, Property Tax analysis, Operating Cost Adjustments, and Rent Inquires.  Supports managers and customers on a variety of tasks and projects to meet deadlines.  Continuously exercises discretion and independent judgment on the analysis, planning, and/or implementation of important program initiatives.  Provides basic support of new Business Data Analysts in the form of training, mentoring, and shadowing opportunities.  Ability to cross train over each LCA region to support other teams.  Ability to provide support of national initiatives that the LCA program manages. Such as portfolio wide modifications. Qualifications Qualifications  :   Must be a U.S. Citizen  Must a past federal pre-employment background investigation.  Associates Degree or equivalent experience. Equivalent experience includes: 4+ years experience supporting program data analysis activities with no related degree; OR  2+ years experience supporting program data analysis activities with related Associates Degree; OR  No experience with a related BA or BS degree.  Specializes in data analysis in one or more of the following areas: Tax; Finance; Accounting; Budgeting; Auditing; Quality control; Research; Legal and regulatory compliance; Administration.  Other similar management and operation activities.  Superior customer service, interpersonal, and communication skills.  Ability to take the initiative and use independent judgment.  Has held the Business Data Analyst position for at least 1 year.  Ability to utilize multiple applications, Google Sheets and Microsoft office suite.  Highly organized and detail oriented.  Transparent communicator with superior written and oral communication skills.  Pragmatic team player who is not confined by a job description and is willing step in to assist where needed no task is too big or too small for you.  Excellent problem-solving skills.  Strong active listening skills  Superior organization skills  Outstanding attention to detail  Why Consider This Opportunity  Great benefits package that starts on the first day of employment: Personal Time Off, Vacation, Sick Leave  Medical Insurance  Vision Insurance  Dental Insurance  Flexible Spending Account Options  Short Term Disability, and Long-Term Disability  Life Insurance, Accidental Death & Dismemberment  Employee Assistance Program  Commuter Benefits  401 (k) with 5% employer match; 100% immediate vesting  MIRACORP is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We encourage Veterans to apply!

title: Sr Business Intelligence Analyst -OneStream
job_description: Requisition ID:  31982At Terumo Blood and Cell Technologies, our 7,000+ global associates proud to come to work each day, knowing that what we do impacts the lives of patients around the world.We make medical devices and related products that are used to collect, separate, manufacture and process various components of blood and cells. With our innovative technologies and service offerings, we touch a patient’s life every second of every day and are committed to continuing to increase the number of patients we serve.With some of the best and brightest minds in the industry, an unmatched global footprint, comprehensive benefits and a distinct culture, Terumo Blood and Cell Technologies is a great place to work, grow and be part of a team that is focused on making a difference. Consider joining our team and unlock your potential.JOB TITLE: Senior Business Intelligence Systems Analyst (OneStream)Job SummaryThis position will develop and maintain strong relationships with multiple departments within the Finance function while delivering high quality BI system solutions to our internal customers. This role requires both tight team collaboration and the ability to work on project components independently. Responsible for providing high-level, as well as detailed, quantitative, and qualitative analytical system support and consulting to the finance organization, leveraging the various financial system applications and data sets. In the role you will be responsible for managing the day-to-day functionality of our Planning & Consolidation systems and the integration with our systems – SAP, Azure DataLake, Workday Adaptive, Power BI, OneStream etc. This role will proactively support critical business strategies by overseeing the maintenance and enhancements of the systems in collaboration with Finance team leaders.Essential DutiesManage data integrations into Planning,Consolidation and reporting systems from SAP, Azure DataLake, and other source systems as appropriate, serve as a primary point of contact for business and IT teamsWorks independently planning and scheduling activitiesRecommends and implements modifications to existing policies & procedures Provide project leadership for systems enhancements projectsMonitor deployment of additional Planning & Consolidation system functionality/upgrades release, completing and coordinating testing and communication to key stakeholdersManage business rules impacting calculations, allocations, and data repositories for the purpose of facilitating the Company’s annual budgeting, forecasting and actual reportingPlan, review, and revise configurations and customizations to meet evolving business and operational needsDevelop, document, and implement policies, procedures, guidelines, and best practices to ensure data integrity and standardized end user processesDocument and roll out training on reporting and dashboards to customer baseTroubleshoot intermittent data and/or break/fix issuesMaintain system security, user permissions Analyze business requirements and translate them into effective & efficient application configurationManage design and support of data visualization and reportsImplement data visualizations, dashboarding, and reporting solutions that will drive meaningful insights and business decisions for customersCreate a user friendly reporting and analytics environment so users have rapid access to necessary data, analytics and reports Analyzes complex problems and implements solutions to ensure consistency and accuracy of the financial systemsCreate and maintain documentation including requirements, design, and user manualsBuild ad hoc analysis to support user needs and requestsCoaches and transfers knowledge to less experienced team members and customersAct as back-up across our key financial systems tasks to ensure business continuityMinimum Qualification RequirementsEducationBachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Business, Finance, Accounting, or related field. Master’s Degree PreferredExperienceMinimum 7 years' of relevant financial analytics, FP&A, accounting or financial reporting experience Minimum of 3 years experience supporting, developing and/or administering a modern cloud based financial consolidation, planning or reporting systems (SAP, Oracle, Workday Adaptive, OneStream, etc.). Experience implementing modern cloud based financial software solutions a strong plusExperience with Workday Adaptive Planning, OneStream and/or PBI reporting a strong plusExperience using MS tools such as Excel, Access, PowerPivot, Desktop PowerBI, etc. SQLExperience working in an international organization with multiple currencies and multiple manufacturing entities preferredERP system experience (SAP, Oracle, etc.) with exposure to master data maintenance best practicesData testing and validation of systems and processesSkillsSelf-directed individual with strong motivation and willingness to take initiative. Should work independently but accept constructive supervisionAbility to build and develop effective PowerPoint presentations Dashboard, analytics and enterprise reporting development skills with a keen eye for design and data organizationData analysis skills, using MS tools such as Excel, Desktop Power BI, etc. Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical audiencesDashboard development with a keen eye for design and data organizationAbility to interact with customers, gathering requirements and turning them into meaningful reportsAbility to train and communicate to customers and internal users on reports and dashboard product offeringsAn analytical, creative thinker who can focus on the details without losing sight of the big pictureStrong attention to detailAbility to work cooperatively and collaboratively with all levels of associates and managementSuperior communication skills and the ability to collaborate with all levels of an organizationDemonstrated technical knowledge of accounting standards and practices Ability to lead small projects utilizing basic Project Management fundamentalsPhysical RequirementsTypical Office Environment requirements include: reading, speaking, hearing, close vision, walking, bending, sitting, and occasional lifting up to 20 pounds.The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential duties of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties.Target Pay Range: $110,400.00 to $138,000.00 - Salary to be determined by the education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market dataTarget Bonus on Base: 7.0%At Terumo Blood and Cell Technologies, we provide competitive total reward offerings that consist of compensation, benefits, recognition, along with a wealth of other well-being, work-life and recognition programs which support in unlocking the potential for you and your family. Included in our expansive list of benefits offerings are multiple group medical, dental and vision plans, a robust wellness program, life insurance and disability coverages, also a variety of voluntary programs such as group accident, hospital indemnity, critical illness, pet insurance and much more. To help you save for retirement, we offer a 401(k) plan with a matching contribution and for work-life balance we have vacation and sick time programs for associates. For us, it’s about protecting the personal welfare of our associates and their families, helping to achieve personal goals and offering those extra touches for convenience, security and overall peace of mind. Terumo Blood and Cell Technologies is part of Terumo Group, founded in 1921 and headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. In 2019, Terumo Blood and Cell Technologies reached $1 billion in revenue. We employ nearly 7,000 associates globally, with global headquarters in Lakewood, CO, U.S., and regional headquarters in Brussels, Buenos Aires, Singapore and Tokyo. We manufacture devices, disposable sets and solutions at our facilities in Belgium, India, Japan, Northern Ireland, the U.S. and Vietnam. Our global presence enables us to serve customers in more than 130 countries. Our core values help set our direction, guide our actions and keep us true to our corporate mission of contributing to society through healthcare. Respect – Appreciative of othersIntegrity – Guided by our missionCare – Empathetic to patientsQuality – Committed to excellenceCreativity – Striving for innovationWe contribute to the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society (LLS), raising $1.3 million USD since 2007. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Affirmative Action Employer. All applicants will be afforded equal opportunity without discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, order of protection status, national origin or ancestry, citizenship status, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, military status or an unfavorable discharge from military service.Terumo Blood and Cell Technologies is committed to providing a safe, healthy and secure working environment. Our Colorado campus locations are tobacco-free workplaces, and we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing and detailed background verification.

title: Financial Analyst
job_description: DescriptionAs a member of the company’s Corporate Finance team, the Financial Analyst will be responsible for a variety of reporting and analytical functions. The analyst will develop reports and financial models for existing markets and assets that analyze business performance, support long-range planning, and model future performance and business valuations. title: Project Coordinator
job_description: Requisition ID: 5863Location:Canon City, CO, US, 81212Pay Type: HourlyEstimated Wage Range: $24-$32 / HourlyARE YOU READY TO BUILD PROGRESS WITH US? Driven by our purpose: Building progress for people and the planet. We are transforming to become the global leader in innovative and sustainable building solutions. Holcim is enabling greener cities, smarter infrastructure and improving living standards around the world. With sustainability at the core of its strategy Holcim is becoming a net zero company, with its people and communities at the heart of its success. The company is driving circular construction as a world leader in recycling to build more with less. Holcim is 70,000 people around the world who are passionate about building progress for people and the planet through four business segments: Cement, Ready-Mix Concrete, Aggregates and Solutions & Products.Description:About The RoleThe Project Coordinator is an entry level project management position, used to combine current education and construction knowledge with training on daily project management duties and responsibilities. The Project Coordinator will be involved with all administrative functions needed to assist Project Managers, Field Engineers, Cost Analyst and technical disciplines associated with assigned projects. The Project Coordinator will assist in scheduling, planning, forecasting, and resource management of all technical activities to ensure project accuracy, timeliness, quality and costs controls are properly managed.What You'll Be DoingAssist Project Manager and Field Engineer as neededAttend weekly scheduling/progress meetingsAttend pre-construction conferences as required, take notes, communicate and accurately log commitments, issues, and necessary actionsVerify that onsite Safety meetings are being performed in accordance with company policy and that safe work practices are being followedAssist Field Engineer in conducting Job Hazard Analysis with field personnel to ensure safe work practicesHelp ensure that projects are being built according to design plans and specificationsTrack material and progress quantities on a daily basis to ensure that project remains on budget and scheduleConfirm that all project related paperwork, to include: time cards, equipment inspections, project correspondence, job cost information, notes, safety meeting rosters, human resource/employee documents, etc… are getting from the field to the office dailyAssist in field surveying and project as-built topos as neededHelp to verify material P.O.’s correspond to actual project needs and ensure that materials and subcontractors are scheduled in a timely mannerReview progress billings with PM to ensure all elements of work are being billed accurately and in a timely mannerParticipate in daily pre-task planning for the field employees to identify areas of potential safety hazards as well as to give the employees any technical insight as to the job at handTake project photos to document project progress and properly upload to appropriate fileWork closely with the Safety Managers to help instill the company’s safety culture in employeesWill execute a variety of project management administrative tasks such as billing and bookkeeping in support of the projectRelationship With Other JobsThis position will work with Project Manager, Sub-Contractors, Field Leadership and employees. They will communicate and work together to ensure the customer’s needs are met in a safety and constructive manner.What We Are Looking ForEducation: High school diploma or equivalent or 2 years of equivalent experience in the construction industry.Experience: 2 years in construction industryKnowledge, Skills, and Abilities:Ability to read, write, and speak well (English);Basic math skills (American system of metrics; English);Valid Driver’s License.Additional Requirements:Demonstrate a commitment to communicating, improving and adhering to health, safety and environmental policies in all work environments and areas. Promote a culture of safety and exhibit these behaviors. Successful candidates must adhere to all safety protocols and proper use of Holcim approved Personal Protection Equipment ("PPE"), including but not limited to respirators. Subject to applicable law, employees that are required to wear respirators must be clean shaven where the respirator seal meets the face in order to pass the qualitative and quantitative fit tests.This position is expected to be open until 05/31/2024Your Holcim ExperienceAt Holcim, there is endless opportunity for you to play your part. Whether you’re in a technical, managerial, or frontline role, you can shape a career that works for you. With us you’ll have the chance to embrace the passion we share for our planet. You’ll be encouraged to seek out diverse perspectives, share your ideas and build the skills and connections you need to perform at your best. Because it’s only when we work together in a culture where everyone thrives, that we can build the world we all want to live in.Click To View Company Benefits OverviewIn compliance with the ADA Amendments Act (ADAAA), if you have a disability and would like to request accommodation in order to apply for a position with us, please call (773) 355-4557 or email recruiting-accommodations@holcim.com. This email address and phone number should only be used for accommodations and not general inquiries or resume submittals.Please visit our Pay Transparency Policy StatementDriven by our purpose to build sustainable solutions for people and our planet, Holcim US encourages interested candidates who meet many, even if not all of the job requirements to apply for a position. We provide a safe working environment for all and strive for diversity in our teams and inclusivity in our work.We take pride in our hiring processes and our commitment to all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, ethnicity, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, genetic information, citizenship, physical or mental disability, past, current, or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Our goal is to drive diversity in our teams and inclusivity in our work. title: ServiceNow Business Systems Analyst, Global
job_description: About Vantage Data CentersVantage is committed to being a workplace of inclusion, equity, respect and acceptance. We celebrate diversity and intentionally seek out opportunities to learn from one another’s experience.Vantage Data Centers powers, cools, protects and connects the technology of the world’s well-known hyperscalers, cloud providers and large enterprises. Developing and operating across North America, EMEA and Asia Pacific, Vantage has evolved data center design in innovative ways to deliver dramatic gains in reliability, efficiency and sustainability in flexible environments that can scale as quickly as the market demands.Technology & Systems DepartmentThe Technology & Systems Department for Vantage Data Centers is very hands-on. In most cases, we specify, purchase, configure and maintain all networking and server hardware. We also work closely with partner VARs to learn about the latest technological changes so we can make informed purchase decisions. The IT (Information Technology) department is always looking for ways to strike the best balance between technology, performance, and cost.Vantage Technology & Systems also participates in designing each of our new data center building’s networking infrastructure, including but not limited to diverse pathways connecting to carriers, meet-me room (MMR) hosting (rack, cabs, ladders, cross-connect panels…), wireless AP (Access Points) coverage, etc. If you like getting your hands dirty and helping to design, build and maintain IT infrastructure in a modern data center, then come work at Vantage. We are expanding with many new builds!Position OverviewThe ServiceNow Business Systems Analyst will play a key role in maintaining and maturing the ServiceNow platform. In addition, you may also contribute to the technical design, ServiceNow code and architecture, and work with key business units to build solutions and processes, support maintenance, continual service improvement, and build new capabilities on the ServiceNow platform. Business Continuity Management (BCM).The incumbent must have strong written and verbal communication skills.ResponsibilitiesClosely partner with the ServiceNow leadership team help maintain and internal users to identify business needs, develop system requirements, and translate requirements into technical specifications for developersWork directly with the ServiceNow Developer to provide effective and quantitive enhancements and remediationsConduct User Acceptance Testing (UAT), fix failures, conduct quality assurance checks, debug and solve issues, and help determine solutionsPresent release notes as items move to production for team awareness.Lead meetings, facilitate training, and assist in communicating and implementing new processes and solutions.Collect user feedback regarding system performance and work with the ServiceNow team to prioritize configuration requestsInterpret information, ideas and instructions and communicate clearly and accurately both verbally and in writingEnsure business solutions meet strategic goals through project management and analyzing functional and systems requirements and driving productivityPerform system data audits and business analysis to identify key metrics (SLAs (Service Level Agreements) and KPIs (Key Performance Indicators)) to drive/support strategic business decisionsPrepare reports and dashboards for systems monitoring and to determine gaps and opportunities for improvementBasic Qualifications5+ years of direct experience working with ServiceNow and supporting modules5+ years of experience with other systems, relational databases, business operations; preferably with working knowledge of data and operational needs across different business functionsSolid understanding of systems and working with platforms such as ServiceNow, Workday, etc.Superb verbal and written communication skills; ability to speak to various partners with different technical skill levels and the ability to define requirements for developersAbility to learn and exhibit developer-level understanding and an understanding of Agile methodology; ability to define and document system requirements and workflows for developers.Functional analyst who can lead meetings with both technical staff and user groupsSolid project management and organizational skills; experience participating in technology and software projects is preferred.Strong critical thinking skills and the ability to empathize with users to evaluate the user journey and determine opportunities for improvementAbility to analyze processes within a multi-functional organization; effective in implementing new and improved processes.Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and ambiguous environment with quick deadlines and shifting priorities.Possesses strong organization skills with the ability to handle various tasksAdditional Details:Salary Range: $120,000 - $135,000 Base + Bonus (this range is based on Colorado market data and may vary in other locations)This position is eligible for company benefits including but not limited to medical, dental, and vision coverage, life and AD&D, short and long-term disability coverage, paid time off, employee assistance, participation in a 401k program that includes company match, and many other additional voluntary benefits.Compensation for the role will depend on a number of factors, including your qualifications, skills, competencies, and experience and may fall outside of the range shown.We operate with No Ego and No Arrogance. We work to build each other up and support one another, appreciating each other’s strengths and respecting each other’s weaknesses. We find joy in our work and each other, actively seeking opportunities to inject fun into what we do. Our hard and efficient work is rewarded with an above market total compensation package. Please still apply if you think you are the right person for the position. title: Control Analyst
job_description: Entity: Production & OperationsJob Family Group: Finance GroupJob Description: The role of the Control Analyst is to provide accounting, reporting, and control (ARC) support for BPX Energy midstream business units (BUs). The analyst serves not only as a business advisor to ensure correct application of policies and processes, but also ensures the integrity of actuals for the BUs. The analyst interacts with teams across the BU and functional landscape to coordinate/gather data to address issues and to ensure alignment and compliance with our accounting and governance policies.KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:Maintain an effective control environment, ensure compliance with accounting policy.Monitor the operating effectiveness and efficiency of internal controls, identify and mitigate risks and gaps, eliminate unnecessary complexity.Assess business context to advise BUs on accounting and control application, seek to influence and assure decision making processes.Support validation of BU actuals by completing monthly cost reviews and analysis; monitor trends and identify anomalies.Lead quarterly due diligence process.Provide governance assurance prior to operational activities.Delegation of Authority (DoA) oversight and control via maintenance activities, guidance, and communication within the BUs.Support BU partner audits.Liaise with Outsource Accounting Provider on recurring basis regarding standard and ongoing accounting activities.Work closely with BU Finance to support the business and seek opportunities to drive innovation and efficiencies between the teams.ESSENTIAL EDUCATION: Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting/Finance/Business, or related disciplines.ESSENTIAL EXPERIENCE AND JOB REQUIREMENTS:3-5+ years accounting/financial experience in the oil & gas industry.Strong analytical skills and performance bias.Sound understanding of E&P and Midstream business.Experience with SAP/SAP PRA/SAP HANA.Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office products, particularly Excel.Familiarity with accounting and financial control policies / practices.Ability to analyze large volumes of data, recognize trends, and recommend solutions.Motivated, self-starter enthusiastic about affecting change.Ability to work simultaneously on multiple projects, at times with conflicting priorities and compressed deadlines with a strong track record of delivery.Ability to collaborate and build alignment with individuals and within multi-discipline teams.Strong written and oral communication skillsExperience with PowerBI or other data reporting/analytical tools and applying these tools to streamline/automate processes;We offer a reward and wellbeing package to enable your work to fit with your life. These can include, but not limited to, access to health, vision and dental insurance, flexible working schedule, paid time off policy, discretionary annual bonus program, long-term incentive program, and a generous 401K matching program. How much do we pay (Base)? $81,000 - $109,000.Note that the pay range listed for this position is a good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible base compensation at the time of posting. Travel RequirementUp to 10% travel should be expected with this roleRelocation Assistance:This role is not eligible for relocationRemote Type:This position is a hybrid of office/remote workingSkills:Accounting, Accounting Policies, Accounting policy, Accounting processes and financial systems, Analytical Thinking, Analytics Insights, Business Process Improvements, Collaboration, Data Analysis, Financial accounting and reporting, Internal control and compliance, Stakeholder EngagementLegal Disclaimer:We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, socioeconomic status, neurodiversity/neurocognitive functioning, veteran status or disability status. Individuals with disabilities may request a reasonable accommodation related to bp’s recruiting process (e.g., accessing the job application, completing required assessments, participating in telephone screenings or interviews, etc.). If you would like to request an accommodation related to the recruitment process, please contact us to request accommodations.If you are selected for a position and depending upon your role, your employment may be contingent upon adherence to local policy. title: Helly Hansen is looking for a Digital Analyst (Global)
job_description: Founded in Norway in 1877, Helly Hansen continues to develop professional grade apparel that helps people stay and feel alive. Through insights drawn from living and working in the world’s harshest environments, the company has developed a long list of first-to-market innovations, including the first supple waterproof fabrics more than 140 years ago. Other breakthroughs include the first fleece fabrics in the 1960s, the first technical base layers in the 1970s, made with LIFA® Stay Dry technology, the patented H2Flow™ temperature regulating system, and the revolutionary lighter, warmer LIFALOFT™ insulation. Building on Helly Hansen’s proprietary HELLY TECH® waterproof/breathable system, the technical outdoor brand has most recently introduced the award-winning LIFA INFINITY PRO™ - the company’s most innovative and responsible waterproof/breathable technology to date. Helly Hansen is a leader in technical sailing and performance ski apparel, as well as premium workwear. Its uniforms are worn and trusted by more than 55,000 professionals and can be found on Olympians, National Teams, and at more than 200 ski resorts and mountain guiding operations globally. Helly Hansen’s outerwear, base layers, sportswear and footwear are sold in more than 40 countries around the world and the company is owned by Canadian Tire Corporation (CTC). To learn more about Helly Hansen’s latest collections, visit www.hellyhansen.comThe RoleAt Helly Hansen we are driving for global Revenue growth. This role will be responsible for analyzing the performance of our D2C digital business and performance marketing campaigns. You will analyze Helly Hansen sales, website, and marketing campaign data to evaluate performance and helping to drive future acquisition, conversion, and retention opportunities.Using data, insight and analytics you’ll partner closely with the ecommerce and performance marketing teams to make help drive the e-comm and performance marketing strategy. You’ll provide accurate and timely reports that include actionable insights, as well as commentary that helps the teams make informed decisions on future activity.This role will be based in Denver, US but will also support out our European business.Key ResponsibilitiesMonitor and analyse the performance of Helly Hansen’s website vs defined KPI’sMonitor and evaluate the effectiveness of marketing acquisition, retention and loyalty campaignsEvaluate AB test performance across user testing and performance marketingProvide accurate, timely reporting including performance commentary and action orientated recommendationsPartner with marketing and e-commerce stakeholders to help build incremental growth strategiesPartner with the performance marketing team to develop a clearly defined attribution modelUse data and analytics to help solve identified business problemsUse data and insight to continuously build a better understanding of our customersUse data and insight to monitor competitor activities so as to benchmark Helly Hansen performanceOrganizational structureReports to: Analytics DirectorLocation: Denver, USWhat We Are Looking For3+ years working in a digital marketing analytics role, preferably with an e-commerce retail brandStrong analytical skillsAbility to process complex data sets and use statistical analysis to create clear actionable insightsAbility to translate complicated data and insight into simple communications and updates, grounded in commercial performanceHighly experienced in using web analytics tools such as Google AnalyticsHighly proficient in use of Excel, SQL, R, Python and TableauAbility to set up and evaluate campaigns in digital marketing platforms such as Meta and GoogleStrong understanding of digital marketing techniques covering SEO, search and display advertisingStrong understanding of test and learn methodologyStrong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple campaigns/projects at onceStrong verbal and written communication skills in English with strong attention to detailExperience in sports marketing or an interest in skiing or sailing sports is a plusWork EnvironmentAbility to thrive in a lean, high growth environmentAbility to work well across functions, diverse communities, and different time zonesWe offerA culture that rewards excellence in an exciting phase of growth and new opportunitiesAn ambitious, dynamic, creative, and international environmentDiscounts on great gear Competitive compensation and benefits, and an active environment with passion for sportsTravel Requirements: Ability to travel, including potential international travelThis position is a full-time employment. Salary range will be $90,000 to $110,000 base.Any questions can be directed to: melissa.pohle@hellyhansen.com. Application is ONLY accepted in portal and not later than 19 May 2024.

title: Senior Pricing Analyst
job_description: ** This position will be required to work from an assigned Xcel Energy location on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays, with the option to work from home, on Mondays and Fridays. **Position Summary  Performs supporting analysis and develops proposals to maintain effective pricing for Xcel's utilities. Works with the Director of Regulatory Pricing and Analysis and other staff to develop effective pricing proposals for a regulated environment.  Essential ResponsibilitiesPrepare and also guide lower-level analysts in the preparation of the rate design proposals and requirements for general rate case filings, miscellaneous filings, and other regulatory filings as required. Proactively develop pricing proposals to meet the needs of the business units, increase options available to customers, and comply with regulatory requirements.Work through all aspects of development and approval to bring the proposal to implementation.Conduct cost of service studies, including comprehensive class cost of service studies, to ensure accurate and timely cost information is available for general rate cases, and other rate design needs.Develop new rate design proposals or modifications of existing rate structures for implementation in regulated utility jurisdictions.Ensure an effective pricing strategy for the Xcel utilities operating in a regulated environment.Develop, propose, and gain regulatory approval of pricing strategies that support the accomplishment of Xcel's business objectives.Coordinate projects within area of specialization to ensure timely and accurate completion of necessary analyses for rate cases, rate design, revenue forecasting or cost of service studies.Communicate and partner with the business units to ensure their informational needs are met.Develop revenue forecasts and reports of historic revenues for official Company budgets and rate cases.Develop and implement revenue recovery and refund mechanisms to ensure full cost recovery and comply with regulatory requirements. Minimum RequirementsBachelor's degree in economics, Engineering, Mathematics, or other technical field and 4 to 7 years' experience in Rate Design; or a combination of education and experience providing equivalent knowledge.Advanced degree in one of the above areas is desirable.

title: Power BI Data Analyst
job_description: Title: PowerBI Data AnalystLocation: 5 days a week onsite in either Kearney, NE, Colorado Springs, CO, or Yankton, SD**RELO PACKAGE AVAILABLE**Duration: PermanentSalary: $80,000-$100,000 with additional 10-12% annual bonusInterview Times: Wednesday – 10:30 am – 12:00 pm; 1:30 pm -5:00 pmThursday 3:00 pm -5:00 pmFriday – 8:00 am -12:00 pm; 1:00 pm- 5:00 pm  MUST HAVES:Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Science, Business, or a related field3+ Years of experience with Power BIExperienced with defining the relationships between tables in a data modelSSBI (self-service business intelligence) experienceExperienced working within Azure cloud repositories within PowerBISQL Database experiencePLUSSES:Development experienceERP Systems Experience (SAP, ManMan, or MSS)Day to Day:One of our customers in the manufacturing space is looking for a Digital & IT Analyst to sit full-time onsite in either Kearney, NE, Colorado Springs, CO, or Yankton, SD. The Digital and IT Analyst is responsible for analyzing use and needs, then developing and applying current information technology to satisfy business requirements or solve business-related issues. This person is also expected to analyze and apply Enterprise data to make recommendations to streamline & simplify processes and develop and deploy appropriate digital and information technology solutions. This candidate needs to be flexible to do overnight travel to remote locations to assist in the implementation of technical solutions as needed and provide after-hour technical support as needed.

title: Associate Manager, DashMart - Product Operations
job_description: About The TeamDashMart is a staple of our New Verticals function here at DoorDash, focused on building a new type of convenience store that offers both household essentials and local restaurant favorites to our customers' doorsteps.About The RoleYou will sit on our DashMart Strategy & Operations team, with a focus on supply chain. In this role, you will own the entire lifecycle of product implementations, from sparking ideas to executing game-changing products, tools, and processes that catapult DashMart's growth and efficiency. You will help scale our EDI platform through the implementation of net-new documents, and improving the flow of data between our systems through integration enhancements. You will identify opportunities for process optimization and implement improvements to enhance overall supply chain efficiency. You will be responsible for requirements gathering, overseeing solution builds, user acceptance testing (UAT), change management, and runway/roll out for all your projects. You will collaborate with Product and Engineering, Business Systems, Accounting, Operations and other DashMart teams to build solutions and operationalize rollout.You will report into the Manager on our Product Operations team. We are in a hybrid model, so we spend some time in person & some time working from home.You’re Excited About This Opportunity Because You Will…Lead. You’ll lead the implementation of several DashMart programs (across product, tooling, process and integrations).Build. You’ll manage and develop sustainable processes, tools, and systems to enable our Supply Chain team to be efficient and optimizedAnalyze. You’ll use SQL to derive quantitative insights on the current state of our tools and identify new ways to approach our future state.Collaborate. You’ll work closely with Business Systems, Accounting, Product, Engineering, Operations and external third party vendors to build scalable systems and processes to support all business partners.Flex. You’ll sit in Operations, but you’ll wear different hats (product manager, project manager, change manager, strategist, data analyst) in order to drive outcomes for covered projects. We’re Excited About You Because…You're an owner. You are detail-oriented and organized, and not afraid to get your hands dirty to “do what it takes” to get things done.You make room at the table for diverse perspectives. Navigating complex problems and leading stakeholders towards a common goal, you prioritize the need to foster critical cross functional relationships from diverse parts of the businessYou solve problems from first principles. You're excited to solve problems in innovative ways, and you resist "this is how it's always been done" thinking. You love working with data and can work independently in SQL to root cause problems.You're unafraid of ambiguity. Rapid change and learning is exciting to you, and you thrive in ambiguous, startup environments.You understand the procure-to-pay lifecycle and have experience working in systems such as EDI, ERPs and WMSs.You’re a clear communicator. You can gather information from multiple sources and distill complex problems into succinct statements for different audiences. You have 4-6+ years of experience within project, product or program management. You’ve succeeded in fast-paced cultures (tech, operations, strategy, consulting, banking, or a related experience), and you’ve led teams to achieve audacious goals.About DoorDashAt DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly, learn, and reiterate in order to make impactful decisions that display empathy for our range of users—from Dashers to merchant partners to consumers. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door-to-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods.DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.Our Commitment to Diversity and InclusionWe’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.Statement of Non-Discrimination: In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital/domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on “protected categories,” we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at DoorDash. We value a diverse workforce – people who identify as women, non-binary or gender non-conforming, LGBTQIA+, American Indian or Native Alaskan, Black or African American, Hispanic or Latinx, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, differently-abled, caretakers and parents, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Thank you to the Level Playing Field Institute for this statement of non-discrimination.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and any other state or local hiring regulations, we will consider for employment any qualified applicant, including those with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the applicable regulation.If you need any accommodations, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection.CompensationThe location-specific base salary range for this position is listed below. Compensation in other geographies may vary.Actual compensation within the pay range will be decided based on factors including, but not limited to, skills, prior relevant experience, and specific work location. For roles that are available to be filled remotely, base salary is localized according to employee work location. Please discuss your intended work location with your recruiter for more information.DoorDash cares about you and your overall well-being, and that’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package, for full-time employees, that includes healthcare benefits, a 401(k) plan including an employer match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, wellbeing benefits, paid time off, paid parental leave, and several paid holidays, among others.In addition to base salary, the compensation package for this role also includes opportunities for equity grants.We expect this position to be filled by 6/1/2024.We use Covey as part of our hiring and / or promotional process for jobs in NYC and certain features may qualify it as an AEDT.
